headline: Watermelon Caprese Appetizer
description: Watermelon, mozzarella cheese, and basil skewers are drizzled with olive oil and balsamic vinegar in this fun twist on a caprese appetizer.
name: Watermelon Caprese Appetizer
recipeIngredient: 1 small watermelon, fruit removed with a melon baller
1 (8 ounce) package fresh mozzarella cheese, cut into small pieces
salt and ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Trim basil leaves into small circles about 1 inch in diameter.
Thread watermelon and mozzarella cheese on toothpicks, sandwiching a basil leaf in between. Arrange on a serving plate.
Pour olive oil and balsamic vinegar over toothpicks. Sprinkle salt and black pepper on top.

review.reviewBody: This is a company favorite and a nice twist on the original. To try another twist, substitute mint leaves for the basil. It is outstanding.
Great recipe for social distancing. I used balsamic glaze and it came out wonderfully. Perfect summer app.
Made as directed and it turned out great. Very impressive looking little bites!
I’d thicken the balsamic vinegar...maybe a reduction would be nice, so when I squirted it on finished skewers, it might make a defined line instead of draining off.
Light and refreshing. Salt is a must. I may try this with a slice of jalapeño as well
Love this recipe! It was my first time using watermelon instead of tomatoes. Very refreshing and everyone enjoyed it.
This was very good and refreshing! And for a non-tomato eater I was finally able to enjoy a caprese appetizer. :-)
Everyone loved it. Great new take an old favorite for a summer BBQ.

Nice twist on the traditional caprese appetizer that is made with cherry tomatoes. The watermelon adds a nice pop of freshness, and it really does pair well with the mozzarella, basil and balsamic vinegar. I did use a balsamic glaze that I had on hand, which really adds a nice sweetness. Thanks for the recipe!
This recipe is amazing, first thing to go at any summer get together. We love basil so we use bigger basil leaves and fold them in half, set between the mozzarella and watermelon. You gotta try this!
Liked it. Refreshing. I used feta cubes. Next time would ensure feta bigger so it did not flake off the tooth pick.

We loved this! My mom gave me some cubed watermelon, so I just used that and I also opted to use balsamic glaze b/c I had some on hand from another recipe. The flavors were great! This is a definite keeper for the summer~YUM! Thanks for sharing. :)
